intro: Becium affine, commonly known as the smooth becium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its fruits are small, berry-like structures that contain a single seed. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
